LanguageData.Arachnids.label: spider
LanguageData.Arachnids.description: This rabbit-sized genetically-engineered predator features eight legs, a hard shell, and a venomous bite.
LanguageData.ArachnidsGiant.label: giant spider
LanguageData.ArachnidsGiant.description: This monstrous muffalo-sized genetically-engineered predator features eight legs, a hard shell, and a venomous bite.
LanguageData.ArachnidsGiantQueen.label: giant spider queen
LanguageData.ArachnidsGiantQueen.description: Half the size of a thrumbo, the giant spider queen is a prime example of genetic engineering gone horribly wrong. The queen varieties also have wings capable of flying short distances.
